import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import os

pm_file_path = '../input/pm25-data-for-five-chinese-cities/ShanghaiPM20100101_20151231.csv'
pm_data = pd.read_csv(pm_file_path, index_col='No')
pm_data.head()
source.f08c0b97:
1 No: row number

2 year: year of data in this row

3 month: month of data in this row

4 day: day of data in this row

5 hour: hour of data in this row

6 PM: PM2.5 concentration (ug/m^3)

7 TEMP: Temperature (Celsius Degree)

8 HUMI: Humidity (%)

9 PRES: Pressure (hPa)

10 cbwd: Combined wind direction : Northwest(NW), Northeast(NE), Southeast(SE), Southwest (SW), static wind (CV)

11 Iws: Cumulated wind speed (m/s)

12 precipitation: hourly precipitation (mm)

13 Iprec: Cumulated precipitation (mm)
source.fb5eee8d: Due to the PM only record from 2012 to 2015, so the drop all row from 2010 to 2011
source.93ca0937:
Drop unnecessary coloumn:

- DEWP
